data.title: Australia cricketer Rachel Haynes announces retirement from all forms of cricket
data.description: In the latest development, Australia women cricketer Rachel Haynes has drawn curtains over her international and state career after winning a bucketful of titles. The upcoming season of WBBL will be her last assignment as a player and she will finish her professional career entirely after that.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: Women’s cricket makes a return to Commonwealth Games for 2026 edition
data.description: After huge success in the Commonwealth Games 2022, women’s cricket will return to action in the 2026 edition to be held in Australia. Cricket was re-included in the Commonwealth Games program this year after the Kuala Lumpur Games of 1998 and Australia were the gold medalists in this discipline.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: Indian pacer Anureet Singh retires from all forms of cricket
data.description: Fast bowler Anureet Singh, who played for Punjab Kings, Kolkata Knight Riders, and Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2009-2018, has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket. Anureet, who last played a domestic match in March last year, took to his social media accounts to make the announcement.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: Cricket Australia announce Woolworths association to continue for another two years
data.description: Woolworths Supermarkets have extended their contract with Cricket Australia by two years ensuring their partnership in promoting grassroots cricket in the country runs till at least 2024. The two organizations have initiated sever major programs since 2018, including the Woolworths Cricket Blast.

data.title: "It Was 100% Fake Fielding": Ex-India Cricketer Admits Kohli Was At Fault
data.description: Virat Kohli was accused of 'fake fielding' in the T20 World Cup match against Bangladesh by Nurul Hasan. Even former India cricketer, Aakash Chopra, feels Kohli was at fault.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: Reports | Chris Gayle to play for Gujarat Giants in Legends League Cricket
data.description: As per IANS, Chris Gayle, fondly called The Universe Boss, will play for Gujarat Giants in the upcoming edition of Legends League Cricket scheduled to begin on September 16. Gayle will play alongside his West Indian teammate Lendl Simmons and Virender Sehwag, who will be leading the side.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: ICC confirms Afghanistan government’s ‘agree in principle’ to resume women’s cricket
data.description: The ICC has confirmed that the Afghanistan government supports the global body’s constitution and has ‘in principle’ agreed to resume women’s cricket in the country. There were multiple reports in the past that women’s cricket was banned in Afghanistan under the Taliban administration.

data.title: BCCI offers equal pay for men and women Indian cricketers in a first
data.description: BCCI secretary Jay Shah said that the women cricketers will be paid the same match fee as their male counterparts. Test (Rs 15 lakhs), ODI (Rs 6 lakhs), T20I (Rs 3 lakhs).
data.source: Business Today | Latest Stock Market And Economy News India

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: Cricket's landscape seems to be changing so quickly, feels Kane Williamson
data.description: Kane Williamson believes there is a balance yet to be found between New Zealand duty and leaving the side to play in lucrative franchise leagues. Williamson’s comments came after Trent Boult, who has been released by NZC’s contract and recently retired Colin de Grandhomme bagged BBL contracts.

data.author: SportsCafe Desk
data.title: T20 Cricket is not Ravichandran Ashwin’s cup of tea, remarks Danish Kaneria
data.description: Danish Kaneria has stated that Ravichandran Ashwin is not suited to T20 cricket and so he shouldn’t have played in the World Cup for India. He further stated that it was an appropriate move from Virat Kohli to reserve Ashwin for the longer format while he was the skipper of the Indian team.

data.title: Dinesh Karthik to retire? Indian cricketer drops cryptic Instagram post
data.description: In his Instagram post, Karthik wrote that playing the World Cup for India was a proud feeling for him.
